name: Rancho Valencia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ranch Valencia is a gorgeous property--unfair to call it a hotel--off the beaten path outside of San Diego. It's a great place to go to get away from the world in amazing luxury.
reviews.title: Great pampering experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though my wife and I live in San Diego, we felt like we really got away. The spa was excellent with very nice people who gave us a great facial and massage in a relaxing atmosphere. Dinner was excellent; we had a cheese plate to start, the best pork chop we have ever had for dinner, and an apple galette for desert. We will be back.
reviews.title: Excellent Spa Service and Dining

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the first time we have been back to Rancho Valencia Resort in a few years. We always remembered it as a tranquil, peaceful place where we could relax & get away from it all. Boy, have things changed! We could not believe how noisy it is there. There are constant leaf blowers going from early in the morning until the afternoon - even when we were sunbathing at the main pool! We actually called the front desk to have them stop because it was out of control. They complied but the next day the noise continued. In addition, there is a constant barage of construction trucks going up & down the main road so walking was prohibited except on the limited trails. We felt walking on the road was very dangerous. If you are looking for a relaxing vacation, this is NOT the place
reviews.title: Too Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were looking for a place to celebrate our anniversary without having to go far outside of our city. This place was the perfect getaway whether in or outside of San Diego. The drive up through the grounds instantly sets the tone of a place of relaxation, and that it was. The staff was very attentive, accommodating, welcoming and knowledgeable. They certainly made us feel well taken care of with an above and beyond, but not overwhelming standard of guest service. The spa services are incredible, the staff is well trained and the relaxation room really makes you not want to leave. We are big on food and were pleasantly surprised to see some great sourcing from local farms with not only a creative approach to the menu but equally delicious, as well. The view during brunch was pleasantly relaxing. If there were any negatives it's hard to recount as the staff, grounds and amenities make every effort to ensure your stay is nothing short of exactly why you arrived there in the first place. We would definitely recommend this place as a destination resort, and thankfully this works as a great staycation for us.
reviews.title: Serene Getaway with Amazing Attention to Detail!

reviews.text: Perfect place to rest and relax. The spa facility (included) is beautifully maintained and the staff is professional and kind. The rooms are large yet cozy. Every morning fresh orange juice, a paper and a beautiful view. Great bed and stellar products.
reviews.title: Perfect place to rest and relax. The spa...

reviews.text: I have been traveling from Louisiana for about 4 years for my birthday or Anniversary. The staff is amazing. My daughter cake the restaurant and they made me a birthday cake and delivered it to the room. Wonderful!! Snacks and drinks in room bar are all complimentary!! Spa is fabulous !!!
reviews.title: My favorite resort in USA

reviews.text: When you are driving to the hotel you go several miles through horse country (it is the other side of the freeway from the race track) , through what used to be the middle of nowhere and is now housing. Once you finally get there it definitely is worth the meandering.
reviews.title: Out of the way but otherwise ideal

reviews.text: The staff is very, very accommodating. Our room was big enough that you could seriously live there full time. It had a walk in closet, step down living room with a wet bar and complementary minibar, three T.V.'s and a huge patio - and I believe that is a "standard" villa. Everybody in our group was blown away! While the bed was not the best or worst we have seen, there was no noise from anywhere and it is very easy to get an excellent nights sleep.
reviews.title: Best kept secret in Southern California

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are numerous tennis courts which looked inviting, and a golf course that I am told was good but not great. The meals we had were way above average for a hotel.
reviews.title: Lives up to its reputation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ideal for a meeting or a quick weekend away. While a bit expensive you get what you would expect.
reviews.title: fabulous in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my husband for his birthday to the Rancho Valencia hotel for a quick getaway. The grounds are beautiful with a California/Spanish style. I booked a Del Mar Grove room with private outdoor jacuzzi and the room and setting were really beautiful. The spa is very peaceful and has its own private pool. The massage was great and we really enjoyed our dinner at the hotel restaurant. It was a very relaxing and romantic stay and I think we might make this an annual thing.
reviews.title: Love, Love, Love This Place

reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our romantic get-a-way at Rancho Valencia. Staying in the spacious jr. Grove Suite, with it's own private patio and spa, was such a great experience. Nestled within the lush surrounding gardens, we really did feel away from it all, yet were only minutes from the beach and nightlife. The staff was friendly and always helpful. Orange juice and the newspaper were waiting outside the front door every morning. We didn't eat in the restaurant only because we wanted to experience La Jolla and the Gas Lamp district both nights, so i can't comment on that. Overall, our experience was amazing. We will be coming back for sure.
reviews.title: Great Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I live in San Diego but wanted a relaxing weekend getaway and this was just the spot. From the spa treatments (facial, massage) to the awesome staff, great dinner, and super secluded rooms, our entire stay was quiet and relaxing. We never wanted to leave! The grounds are beautiful and the so is the spa. The patios off all the rooms are a great treat- we were served breakfast on our patio in the am. The adult pool area at the spa was quiet and just what we needed for the weekend. I would stay here again, in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Great little retreat outside the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a secret little getaway for me and my wife. We live in San Diego and try to get to this resort at least once a year. It has a fantastic spa, beautiful grounds and little casitas that you stay in. Private pools, tennis courts, top notch gym - all the top flight amenities available. The one down note was the restaurant. The room service was definitely above average, but the restaurant is nothing spectacular. It's OK, but at a resort like this I would expect much more. Not a deal breaker by any means, just nit picking.
reviews.title: Quiet and relaxing

reviews.text: Having traveled the world many times over, I continue to be awestruck at how some people enjoy throwing their money away. I guess if you ego demands spending $500 a night -go for it..Otherwise, try the Ranch Santa Fe Inn and experience word class service and old world charm for about half the price.
reviews.title: Stupidly Overpriced
Best resort in the US mainland
reviews.text: Wow. Amazing property, incredibly beautiful landscaping. Jr Suites are phenomenal, large, huge bathrooms and master closets, separate shower, two sinks, an outside private dipping pool called a spa, orange juice delivered outside your door each morning, and terrific service staff. 18 tennis courts. What more could one ask for? All I could ask for is someone to greet me at midnight when I drove up to the hotel. Other than being understaffed in the evening, the hotel was amazing.
Try this resort, you will not be disappointed, Just make sure you rent a car, it is off the beaten path.
reviews.title: Lovely place to spend a few days!

reviews.text: This is a very pretty, very friendly resort. It's pricey but the food is excellent, the setting is lovely, and the service is first rate. I would go back. If you're into tennis it's especially good.
reviews.title: First Class Resort-The BEST I have ever seen!!!

reviews.text: We have just completed our 7 days, 6 night stay at the Rancho Valencia Resort and as I type this review outside on our beautiful outdoor spa patio while my daughter and son enjoy their last dip in their outdoor spa pool of our room, I cannot express how much we loved staying at this resort. In previous summers we have stayed at the Pelican Hill Resort, Balboa Bay Beach Club and the Ritz carlton Laguna Nigel in the general area and all I can say is that the Rancho Valencia trumps them all. I have travelled extensively, simply see all the places I have reviewed, and this resort is by far the best for family travel. Let me start with the positives coupled with some next steps for improvement. The resort was amazing however it did have some flaws which can be rectified easily:
reviews.title: Beautifully Cozy

reviews.text: -king zie bed with pull out couch with outdoor spa; very nice room, spacious for a family of 4 however I was not too pleased having my kids spend an entire week on a pull out couch. For the amount you pay each night it would have been nice to have had 2 double beds. The hotel has one room only with 2 double beds which initially we were given however it is an accessible room with no bath tub and with a modified accessible shower with no shower door in order to accomodate accessible guests. When traveling with children you need a bath tub so we changed rooms after a few hours and received a king room with pull out. I did not receive, at least to my knowledge, an upgrade being a AMX Platinum nor Club 5C member; heck even staying 6 consecutive nights should have given us a better room upgrade in my point of view. I was hopeful the hotel would give us a two bedroom suite as an upgrade however they did not. This is one area that I would suggest to the Resort to improve upon for at least they can recognize those guests who are long staying. We were, to my observation, the only guests that stayed so many consecutive nights.
reviews.title: Fabulous Tennis Weekend

aka: Rancho Valencia, An Auberge Hotel Rancho Santa Fe
